ygData.subject: Posting
ygData.msgSnippet: Interesting topic (RID and such), however can we please keep this to either private email, or onto the website? =) that or post IC messages with it as well.

Interesting topic (RID and such), however can we please keep this to 
either private email, or onto the website? =) that or post IC 
messages with it as well. (an please refrain from the one line "Bob 
looks around" type posts :P)

Dewboy, LN, The Beam, stop bashing each other nobody wants to hear 
it. You're just wasting your time and our time by even posting it. 
Consider what you post BEFORE you post it.

Dewboy. To improve your dialogue, read some novels and model your 
posting after them. You don't necessarily have to post in paragraph 
format, just use the dialogue from a novel as an example for what 
you would write. 
(Background for those who haven't read this: it's a dystopia where 
one person controls all of the negative and postive memories of a 
entire "utopian" community. It's an interesting book, and i recomend 
it.)


ie: (i'll quote a little from The Giver by Lois Lowery, then change 
it)

--------->
"Giver," he asked one afternoon following a day when he had been 
sent away, "what causes you pain?"
  "When the Giver was silent, Jonas continued. "Ther Chief Elder 
told me, at the beginning, that the receiving of memory causes 
terrible pain. And you described for me that the failure of the last 
new Receiver released painful memories to the community.
  "But I haven't suffered, Giver. Not really." Jonas smiled "Oh, I 
remember the sunburn you gave me on the very first day. But that 
wasn't so terrible. What is it that makes you suffer so much? If you 
gave some of it to me maybe your pain would be less."
  The Giver nodded. "Lie down," he said. "It's time, I suppose. I 
can't shield you forever. You'll have to take it all on eventually.
  "Let me think," he went on, when Jonas was on the bed, waiting, a 
little fearful.
  "All right," The Giver said after a moment, "I've decided. We'll 
start with something familiar. Let's go once again to a hill, and a 
sled."
  He placed his hands on Jonas's back.
---------->


The above was simply an exerpt form The Giver. Now i'll switch the 
style and write a little transformer dialogue between say Lokk and 
Axis who are scouting a Predacon operation where three Preds are 
loading up a crate of something.


---------->
"Lokk," murmured Axis, "Lokk!" He nudges Lokk with his elbow, "Look 
at what they are carrying.
  "Hmmm," thinks Lokk, "It looks like explosives in boxes," he 
observes as the trio of Preds slowly and gently move the large crate 
towards they're transport.
  Axis's eyes change colour as a magnification lense slides over his 
optics. "I see some characters written on the crate... I see, an, A, 
an S, and U, and an S. Then there's a space, and A, a 7, an M, and 
another space, then a C, a P, and a U. Do you have any idea what 
that means?" says Axis as he continues to watch.
  Lokk frowns and pieces the letters together in his head, << A-S-U-
S__A-7-M__C-P-U... that sounds like computer equipment to 
me.>> "Axis, I think that they have some new computer equipment or 
something. We might be able to capture it and bring it back to base. 
We have the element of surprise."
  Axis nods, "Yah, I think that we can do it, but we'll need Seekker 
as well." He looks at Lokk who nods.
  "Alright." Lokk opens an encrypted commlink to Seekker, "Seekker, 
we need you, what is your position?"
--------->


Another simple way to write the same thing is the following:


--------->
Axis: "Lokk. Lokk! Look at what they are carrying."
Axis nudges Lokk with is shoulder.

Lokk: "Hmmm, looks like explosives to me."
Lokk continues to watch the three Preds.

Axis' eyes change colour as a magnification lense slides over his 
optics. 
Axis: "I see some characters written on the crate... I see, an, A, 
an S, and U, and an S. Then there's a space, and A, a 7, an M, and 
another space, then a C, a P, and a U. Do you have any idea what 
that means?"

Lokk frowns and thinks about the lettering.
Lokk: "Axis, I think that they have some new computer equipment or 
something. We might be able to capture it and bring it back to base. 
We have the element of surprise."

Axis nods in agreement.
Axis: "We'll need Seekker's help."

Lokk also nods, and opens an encrypted commlink to Seekker
Lokk: "Seekker, we need you, what is your position?"
--------->


If you hadn't already realized it, all of what i've been writing is 
straight from the Rules page, but with a different example.

I already explained this to you before you were moderated as well, 
so you should look back in the posts and read that post as well. 
Also, reread the rules several times until what you know for sure 
that you can create a character or make anything up that won't piss 
someone (or anyone... or everyone) off. =P

Another word of advice: NEVER write a dialogue before hand and 
expect to use it IC. It doesn't really work. Think of this: A static 
mind will never solve a dynamic problem. =)

And for god's sake, let all of my typing that is trying to go to 
help you, go to waste... like before... =(
